Exakis Nelite, entité du groupe Magellan Partners, est le premier partenaire pure-player Microsoft en France avec l’ambition de devenir le premier partenaire Européen et en Afrique Francophone avec sa forte présence au Maroc.
Nés du rapprochement de 2 leaders spécialistes de l’intégration des solutions Microsoft, nous allions expertise technique et fonctionnelle pour répondre concrètement aux enjeux de demain : accélération de la transformation digitale, CyberSécurité, Intelligence Artificielle, IoT, Data, transformation vers le cloud Azure, Services Cognitifs et Intelligence Artificielle…
En rejoignant la communauté Exakis Nelite dans l’une de nos 14 agences, vous intégrerez une équipe passionnée et impliquée dans les projets les plus innovants. Vous rejoindrez une structure construite autour de valeurs tournées vers ses collaborateurs : intelligence collective, convivialité et bienveillance.
Département : Structure
Ville : Grenoble
Type de contrat : CDI
Expérience : 5 ans
Poste et missions
En tant que Service Line Manager, vous pilotez les activités et le développement des offres et projets sur un périmètre géographique ou fonctionnel Agence.
Rattaché(e) à la Direction de l’agence vous êtes chargé-e de :
D’animer une équipe de consultants dans leur quotidien, leurs évolutions et leurs formations
Garant de la bonne tenue des projets, vous vous assurez en permanence de la satisfaction des clients et des consultants
Gérer les risques opérationnels
Elaborer des préconisations, proposer des solutions et senarii d’amélioration

Contribuer activement au développement et l’enrichissement de l’offre autant sur la déclinaison d’un cadre de valorisation commerciale que sur l’efficacité opérationnelle pour les projets
Intervenir lors de la défense de dossiers pour valoriser le savoir-faire de la Société, que ce soit en tant que rédacteur ou participant aux soutenances.
Être un acteur important de la prospection au travers de son positionnement dans différents environnements client.
Développer des compétences des consultants de l’équipe (aide à la résolution des difficultés techniques et comportementales)
Accompagner la montée en compétences techniques des nouveaux consultants

Job Description

We are looking for a Master Data Manager Winter Sports Equipment W/M to:
Be responsible for the implementation of the global master data strategy and to provide support to the business by guiding maintenance of material Master Data in accordance with the Winter Sports Equipment goals and objectives. The position will provide support to the business by assisting in and leading master data related projects. The Master Data Manager will initiate efforts to increase data quality, efficiency and will participate in enhancement opportunities within the master data space.

You will report directly to the Head of Sales Controlling & Sales Operations

Main Activities
Strategy:
Facilitate regular exchange and strategic reviews between brands and shared platforms (IT, SAP, OPS, GTM, etc.)
Act as first contact and networker in terms of master data for the category (brands and transversal functions)
Implement standards, rules and principles as related to master data management on category level (in alignment with global MD)
Identify critical areas and develop risk mitigation plans as related to master data management (e.g. know-how transfer, system, etc.)
Identify, develop and implement processes to maintain high-quality data assets supporting the business in providing quality data, ensuring data consistency, accuracy, and accessibility
Execution:
Facilitate regular trainings and best practice sharing across users and key-stakeholder
(in-/outside the category)
Understand and visualize the interactions in between systems as well as the link in between in-and output (end-to-end)
Drive transparency based on workflows, working instructions, up-to-date documentation, etc.
Act as central contact with regard to all RFC (requests for change) on PLM systems and MD effecting the category (prioritization)
Act as a liaison between the business and IT support staff providing technical solutions that fit the business needs and structure
Propose and execute master data enhancements to achieve more efficient, accurate data
Improvement:
Facilitate and host continuous feedback and improvement session with key-users (heavy users) inside of Winter Sports Equipment
Drive and support the continuous improvement process of systems, interfaces, workflows and data quality
Develop the know-how and expertise of the category in master

Qualifications
Needed Work Experience: Knowledge and Understanding of large and complex data bases, with a minimum of 3-5 years of experience
Education: Bachelor’s degree with business or data-related focus (Information Systems)
Specific Skills:
Knowledge of master data management concepts and approaches
Strong project and time management skills with attention to detail with excellent follow-through
Leadership skills with the ability to influence non-hierarchical, cross-functional work groups to drive to consensus on definitions and data usage
Excellent communication skills in a multicultural organization
Able to work under pressure with multiple deadlines
Analytical experience with high aptitude for research, analysis and problem solving skills
Proactive to challenge the status quo and to recommend innovative solutions
Drive, enthusiasm
Foreign Language(s): Fluent English skills required, German and French skills an advantage

Additional Information

Permanent Contract, Full Time
Location can be Altenmarkt, Annecy or Munich

description:
Sodiaal est né du rapprochement de 7 coopératives laitières régionales, en 1990. Au fil des années, il a considérablement évolué et s'est fortement restructuré afin de répondre aux exigences du marché. En 2011, l'acquisition d'Entremont Alliance lui permet de devenir le 2ème acteur majeur multi-métiers dans le secteur laitier en France avec un éventail de marques à forte notoriété : Candia, Le Rustique, Coeur de Lion, Régilait, Entremont, Yoplait... La fusion avec 3A Coop en 2014 a renforcé sa position de leader sur le marché français et lui a permis de se positionner sur le marché européen et mondial. Le groupe collecte 4,8 milliards de litres de lait, dégage un chiffre d'affaires de 5,4 milliards d'euros, emploie 9 400 salariés et possède plus de 70 sites industriels en France. Sodiaal International est la holding du groupe. Elle remplit des missions de pilotage stratégique et de contrôle. Elle intègre les services partagés pour le compte des filiales afin d'en optimiser les coûts et d'en partager les compétences. La Direction financière, la DRH, la Direction du marketing stratégique, de la recherche et de l'innovation, la Direction des opérations, la Direction du développement coopératif, la direction du développement international, la Direction QHSE font partie de Sodiaal International.
Mission
Rattaché(e) à la DSI, vous intégrez au sein de la Direction Informatique Technology & digital, sous la responsabilité du manager BI & Middleware du Groupe SODIAAL. Intégré(e) au sein de la Direction Informatique Technology & digital, vous êtes rattaché(e)au responsable BI & Middleware du Groupe SODIAAL. Travailler en mode projet ou sur la maintenance corrective et évolutive des applications BI notamment SAP BW (et/ou BW on Hana) sur différents processus métier et dans un contexte multi-site. Développer des solutions de reporting interactif avec l'outil SAP BusinessObjects BI. Maximiser la valeur pour nos clients internes à l'aide des techniques agiles.
Profil
De formation BAC + 5 spécialisée en Informatique ou Mathématique. Minimum 3 ans d'expérience. Maitrise des applications SAP BW et SAP BusinessObjects BI. Expérience souhaitée dans le cloud. Excellentes aptitudes d’analyse, d’organisation et de gestion de données. Bonne capacité à travailler en mode Agile. Esprit d'équipe, goût et bonnes aptitudes relationnelles. Des connaissances dans d'autres domaines de reporting (Ex : Qlik, Power BI), ETL (Ex : Talend, Oracle Data Integrator) et algorithmie seraient un plus. Une expérience en Big Data et sur AWS est un atout.

meta1:
Software Engineer Internship - 6 months
Salesforce532 avis - Grenoble (38)
date_publication:
il y a 22 heures
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Job Category
Intern
Job Details
Software Engineer Internship Program France - 6 months

Start date: 1 February
Duration: 6 months
Location : Grenoble

This is your time to shine! Salesforce is now hiring top talent to join our Futureforce into different departments for a 6 month internship starting on the first of February. Whether you are coming from a technical or creative background, we’d like to hear from you to help you develop your skills and potentially help build your career with Salesforce!

About Salesforce
Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” eight years in a row and on the FORTUNE ‘100 Best Companies to Work For®’ List twelve years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.

Futureforce is Salesforce’s global university recruiting program dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating next generation talent.

We would have potential opportunities within the Search team :
The Search team within Salesforce seeks an outstanding Intern with a passion for software development. As a member of this team, you'll be given the opportunity to have a direct impact on the most used feature of the Salesforce platform early in your career, analyzing and optimizing features that will benefit the millions of users using Salesforce daily. This position requires you to be excited about what makes search better!

- Analyze and Optimize Solr Token Filters :
The number of tokens produced for a chunk of text is a major factor on the efficiency of the search platform: disk size, memory size, indexing speed, search speed. Simple words become one token, but punctuation, symbols, and mixed letter-number combinations ultimately yield multiple tokens. A recent analysis of our tokens showed that many appear to be of no use, thus lowering the efficiency of the platform. Over time our tokenization process has grown increasingly complex but we have not yet put effort into optimizing to a fewer number of tokens. Are you up to the task?

- Large Scale build infrastructure
Your objective, as an intern, will be to work on a proof-of-concept to consolidate the many private github repositories for the search team into a broader git monorepo, and demonstrate that maven can be replaced by bazel (build tool open-sourced by Google) while improving developer productivity (measurable). You will work with modern technologies like Bazel, Jenkins, Docker, Intellij and more. You will be able to leverage a broader company initiative that already implements that approach for other projects.

Optimize query runtime using hundred of signals
If you are interested in data structure and are curious about Solr. You will have the responsibility to find the most efficient approach to store hundreds of signals in solr that would be efficient evaluated at query time.
Build Monitoring at Scale
We are seeking an intern who is passionate about making the life of other engineers easier. We expect as a result a platform automating common monitoring tasks, to improve our capabilities of preventing, detecting and remediating anomalies at scale. The latter platform can leverage technologies such as Jupyter notebooks, Apache Airflow (workflow scheduling), Slack “chatops” bots, or Kubernetes.
Next Generation Query Suggester
You will have the opportunity to:
Understand our current query suggestion system
Develop cutting-edge Natural Language algorithms to generate more advanced suggestions
Find signals and explore new ranking methods for suggestions
Build and leverage user's query history to personalize your suggestions
Evaluate your implementation using billions of search activities from production.
Benchmark and Optimize Worm-Hashing
Your objective as an intern will be first to benchmark the existing code, comparing to multiple other Java hash map libraries open-source. Benchmarking is an area of expertise in itself. Then study the technique and implementation and potentially propose optimizations. In a second time, you will have the opportunity to implement a clean version for open-source. You will be able to study the primitive hash map usages in Lucene, to replace with Worm-Hashing, to adapt to other data structures, and to benchmark potential gains.
- Capture User Interests to drive Better Search
Your objective, as an intern, will be to help identify, build, experiment and evaluate innovative approaches for user interest profiling, recommender systems and search relevance. This challenge is a unique opportunity to have an impact on millions of customers by bringing more intelligence to search !
- Optimize query execution in text search engine
Solr/SolrCloud is a very popular and widely distributed and used integration of the Lucene search engine. The search index structure of Lucene is a set of immutable index segments. Each new indexing batch creates a new segment. Queries to the index have to query all segments separately and merge the results. There are ways to collapse multiple segments into a single (new) one to maintain the number of segments below a defined threshold.

PROGRAM :

The program is an immersive program uniquely designed for university students. You will have many opportunities to impact and learn from colleagues all over the EMEA while having fun and developing your career.
We are the most successful cloud company and your skills, dedication, and curiosity will help us continue to innovate and grow. Working at Salesforce you will have the opportunity to significantly impact how we deliver customer success.

During the program you will acquire official industry standard Salesforce certifications, and gain knowledge and invaluable international experience leading to both professional and personal development. Depending on your profile, a strong emphasis will be placed on learning skills related to the areas of technical consulting, business acumen and how to engage with customers, and through our strong coaching culture, we aim to develop you into a world-class professional, poised to grow your career anywhere at Salesforce.
PROFILE:
We consider applicants from all academic disciplines, and place great emphasis on your cultural fit with our unique Ohana, which is the Hawaiian word for "family", and is one of our most important values. Due to the breadth of roles in our program, at a high-level, we welcome candidates from across three main personas; technical, business, and creative.

Generally, to apply for the Interns Program, you:
Are graduating in 2020 or 2021 (Master degree)
Student in Master degree in Computer Science
Are passionate about the impact technology can have on the world
Proficient in Java or any other high-level programming languages
Are a creative problem-solver
Are ambitious, curious and self-motivated
Are comfortable adapting to new opportunities and change
Are fluent in English and French.

Please apply with your CV and a cover letter.
Posting Statement
Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org.

description:
Come and Join the Cyber Security world
A subsidiary of Airbus Defence and Space CyberSecurity (Airbus Group), Stormshield is the leading European vendor of information system security solutions.
Hacking attempts are commonplace nowadays and it seems that no-one can escape them, be it ministries, banks, industries, etc. Whether they handle sensitive data or not, every company is a target for hacker groups for one reason or another. Regardless of the motive, be it purely financial or strategic, hackers target a company's most vital assets: trade secrets, customer files, confidential company information, etc.
Our solutions protect companies against denial of service attacks, data theft, or damage to reputation, and help them to adhere to regulations concerning data confidentiality.
Product Marketing Manager : job & missions
With a view to boosting the development of our product offering, we are looking to recruit a Product Marketing Manager. Working at the core of the Marketing Team, you will coordinate with all product lines stakeholders to enable successful sales and promote the entire product portfolio. You will be as well responsible of the formalisation and the promotion of the product offers built on top of these products. As a Product Marketing Manager, you will manage outbound marketing for this portfolio: Canvas Value Proposition is part of your DNA, sales kits (presentations, data sheets, videos, etc.) and promotion (webinars, communication strategies, advertisements, newsletters, etc.) are no longer hold any secrets for you. You will also train internal and partners’ sales team, actively participate in the product launches and attend or participate at international exhibitions, events, conferences or seminars, etc. Your creativity will help to develop attractive, interactive and efficient messages and sales tools. You like writing punchy contents and promoting the value of innovative products.
You will also support inbound marketing and corporate communications for products: carry out market research, analyse customer or analyst feedback, monitor activities of technology partners and the security ecosystem, help in the creation of brand contents and participate in the global marketing plan definition.
The position is based in Villeneuve d’Ascq, Lyon, or Issy-Les-Moulineaux (Paris).
Product Marketing Manager : your profileSkills required
Good knowledge of the challenges, technologies and players involved in the digital security market
Good background of software and hardware security technologies
English speaker and writer
Experience in promoting products and services
Ability to create impactful messages
Strengths
Strong attention to detail, capable of working independently, good listening skills
Good writing and public speaking skills
Creative and inquisitive mindset
Can cope with stressful situations and manage priorities well
Ability to argue persuasively and identify and promote value
Education/Training
3 to 5 years of high education in an engineering school, a business school, or a university specializing in IT.
Experience
Minimum of 3 years of experience working as a Product Manager, Product Marketing Manager, Presales or Security Expert is required.
Type d'emploi : CDI
Expérience:
Product Marketing: 3 ans (Souhaité)

Job Description

We are looking for a IT TechOps Release Manager W/M to:
who collaborate with software developers, IT Architects and other IT staff members to provide tools and services in order to develop and deploy Infrastructure as code (I.A.C.) releases.
You will work in close collaboration with our final users, IT engineers, IT Architects, IT Developers, IT Project leads.
You will report directly to the ICS Team Responsible.

Main Activities:
Manage (building, update and evolution). Cross and merge the barriers that exist between software development, testing and operations teams and keep existing networks in mind as they design, plan and test.
Project Planning: participate in the processes of strategic project-planning meetings. Providing guidance and expertise on system options, risk, impact and costs vs. benefits. Create and share the operational requirements and development forecasts to allow for timely and accurate planning of projects.
Development: Responsible for developing and building IT solutions, install and configure solutions, implement reusable components, translate technical requirements, assist with all stages of test data, develop interface stubs and simulators and perform script maintenance and updates.
Deployment: build automated deployments through the use of configuration management technology. Deploy new modules and upgrades and complete fixes within the production environment. Make modules ready for production, which entails moving them according to specific procedures and documenting knowledge transfer.
Maintenance and Troubleshooting: Routine application maintenance tasks are an ongoing responsibility. Accomplish via strategy-building techniques. Help create requirements and procedures for implementing routine maintenance. Troubleshooting existing information systems for errors and resolving those errors.
Performance & Risk Management: evaluate existing applications and platforms, give recommendations for enhancing performance and security via gap analysis, identifying the most practical alternative solutions and assisting with modifications. Participate in controlling costs and monitor the operating budget.

Qualifications
Needed Work Experience:5 years of professional experience
Education: 4/5 year degree course
Specific Skills:
Dev-Ops skills:
proficiency in Infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible, PowerShell, Bash…)
Ability to operate devops tools and solutions (Gitlab, Ansible, Terraform, openshift, elasticseach, Kibana, grafana)
Experience with data Analytics and KPI
Others:
Command of project and service management good practice
Evangelize on the DevOps approach.
Foreign Language(s): proficiency in English
Other Specific Transversal Skills: rigor, organization sense, good social skills, ability to prioritize, analysis capacities, adaptation, spirit of initiative

Additional Information

Permanent Contract, Full Time
Job based in Annecy (74), FRANCE

Missions :
Sécuriser les flux commandes par des contrôles réguliers et procédures. Ces contrôles permettent de s'assurer que :
Toutes les commandes transmises par les magasins, tout périmètre confondus, arrivent en temps et en heure chez les fournisseurs afin que les magasins soient livrés de leurs produits.
Les contrôles sont effectués sur différents environnements en fonction des flux à contrôler.
Gérer les incidents qui peuvent survenir sur la totalité du SI. Les incidents peuvent être de types différents (applicatifs, réseau, système, flux, entrepôts, data center ...).
Le rôle du gestionnaire d'incident est de :
S'assurer que l'incident est créé dans l'outil de ticketing
De contacter les différents prestataires pour s'assurer que le ticket est pris en compte, qu'il est traité ou en cours de traitement
De monter ou de participer à des cellules de crise
De communiquer tout au long de la gestion de l'incident auprès du public concerné jusqu'à sa résolution.
Contraintes :
Travail de nuit
Week-end
Astreintes (+30% sur la rémunération)
Profil recherché :
De formation IT de niveau BAC+2 minimum, vous possédez une première expérience réussie sur un poste similaire.

Vous êtes autonome, rigoureux et vous possédez un excellent savoir-être.

meta1:
ALTERNANCE - PMO RECRUTEMENT_GRENOBLE OU PARIS(H/F)
Atos2,183 avis - Grenoble (38)
date_publication:
il y a 1 jour
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Atos est un leader international de la transformation digitale avec plus de 110 000 collaborateurs dans 73 pays et un chiffre d’affaires annuel de plus de 11 milliards d’euros. Numéro un européen du Cloud, de la cybersécurité et des supercalculateurs, le groupe fournit des solutions intégrées de Cloud Hybride Orchestré, Big Data, Applications Métiers et Environnement de Travail Connecté. Partenaire informatique mondial des Jeux Olympiques et Paralympiques, le Groupe exerce ses activités sous les marques Atos, Atos Syntel, et Unify. Atos est une SE (Société Européenne) cotée sur Euronext Paris et fait partie de l’indice CAC 40.
La raison d’être d’Atos est de contribuer à façonner l’espace informationnel. Avec ses compétences et ses services, le groupe supporte le développement de la connaissance, de l’éducation et de la recherche dans une approche pluriculturelle et contribue au développement de l’excellence scientifique et technologique. Partout dans le monde, Atos permet à ses clients et à ses collaborateurs, et plus généralement au plus grand nombre, de vivre, travailler et progresser durablement et en toute confiance dans l’espace informationnel.

Contexte

Le poste proposé est rattaché à Atos Worldgrid™, filiale internationale d'Atos, leader mondial des systèmes informatiques dans le domaine de l’énergie. Atos Worldgrid intègre et fournit des solutions innovantes pour la production, le transport, la distribution et la commercialisation de l'énergie.
Atos Worldgrid développe mondialement son expertise grâce à plus de 1000 ingénieurs et consultants et recrute environ 50 CDI et 50 stagiaires et alternants chaque année.
Ces bons résultats reposent sur un processus de recrutement rigoureux et la forte mobilisation de tous les acteurs concernés à Grenoble et Paris : les Responsables des Ressources Humaines, les Recruteurs (Recruitment Partners), et tous les Managers Opérationnels.

Votre mission à Grenoble

En tant que PMO Recrutement, vous serez amené à suivre et coordonner cette activité sous la responsabilité du Ressources Manager. Vos tâches principales seront les suivantes :

Aider les managers opérationnels à la rédaction des offres dans les outils du groupe
Faire un premier niveau de sélection des candidats
Suivre l’avancement des dossiers des candidats sélectionnés au fil du processus
Piloter la réunion hebdomadaire de suivi des recrutements
Effectuer le reporting hebdomadaire : suivi des actions, suivi des entrées, production des indicateurs
Effectuer les relances / alerter sur les retards potentiels
Par ailleurs Atos participe aux forums de grandes écoles et organise ponctuellement des événements dans ses locaux. Dans ce cas vous serez amené à :

Participer à la rédaction et consolider les books des stages et/ou offres d’emploi
Préparer l’organisation de ces événements, puis y participer
Sélectionner et diffuser les CV auprès des opérationnels

Enfin nous poursuivons une démarche d’amélioration continue de nos processus et de nos méthodes. Vous pourrez proposer et mettre en œuvre un plan d’actions d’améliorations. Exemple : amélioration de nos outils, rédaction de modes opératoires...
Votre profil
Vous venez d’une école de management, d’un IAE, et vous recherchez une mission en alternance.
Compétences attendues :
Capacités à organiser
Capacités à conduire une réunion avec de nombreux
Interlocuteurs (opérationnels, RRH, recruitment partners)
Capacités à mobiliser, à organiser
Sens du service (support aux Opérationnels), aisance relationnelle, rigueur et souplesse
Capacités à faire un premier niveau de qualification des candidats
Bonne maîtrise d’Excel
Capacités à monter rapidement en compétences sur les outils du groupe Atos
Aisance rédactionnelle / bon orthographe (reporting)

INFORMATIONS ADDITIONNELLES :
Chez Atos la diversité est au cœur de notre politique RH. C'est pourquoi Atos a mis en place un accord relatif à l’égalité professionnelle entre les hommes et les femmes. Par ailleurs, nos métiers sont tous accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap, et ce quelle que soit la nature de leur handicap.

description:
Job description

In close contact with the EMEA organization, for the projects you will be assigned to (current and future portfolio for biorational and conventional products), you will be responsible for the evaluation, development and registration trials as well as relevant sections of the registration dossiers. You will also ensure the transmission of the product know-how internally and externally through product’s training or support for demo trials protocols.

Your main tasks will be

Plan, budget, organize, contract and follow the field trial program

Prepare synthesis and technical summaries

Prepare (with external support) the efficacy sections of the registration dossiers

Contribute to the definitions of our product strategies

Transfer the product know-how to internal and external customers

You will benefit from a large autonomy to bring forward your proposals and secure your creativity to complete those tasks.

You will principally work in relation with

The Insecticide Development and Market Support Leader

The Marketing Product Managers

Contract Research Organizations all over EU

The relevant Global Project Managers in our headquarters in USA and Japan
Profil recherché Required skills and profile

Knowledge

: Graduate with a master’s degree in agronomy

Expertise in field experimentation and related data management, regulatory environment and ideally good expertise in the insecticide area (conventional and/or biorational products)

Experience

: 3-5 years in technical / development positions in the agronomical research area or agrochemical industry with background in the insecticide area

Skills

: Excellent communication and inter-personal skills

Good planning and organization skills

Ability to convince colleagues, customers, officials based on technical expertise

Language

: Good written and oral skills in English (working language)

IT Tools

: Workable knowledge of Microsoft Office and ARM

Additional information

Location : St Didier au Mont d'Or (69) - FRANCE

Desired start : as soon as possible

Contract : permanent contract
Entreprise Sumitomo Chemical is a leading international research and development company commercializing innovative crop protection products both for conventional and organic farming.

In the frame of significant investments in R&D, Sumitomo chemical wishes to strengthen its efficiency and reactivity in the region of Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA).

In this environment, two positions are opened in our EMEA headquarter for:

EMEA MARKET SUPPORT PROJECT MANAGER (M/F)

meta1:
Data Ingénieur.e Kafka - Lyon
Zenika - Lyon (69)
date_publication:
il y a 2 jours
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Tu te dis que choisir et refuser tes missions, faire du télétravail, être formé régulièrement ne sont pas compatibles avec un job en ESN ? Et si on te disait que chez Zenika c’est possible !
Qui sommes-nous ?
Depuis notre implantation en 2009, les Zenilyonnais ont su devenir une valeur sûre et incontournable du marché IT de Lyon.
Idéalement situé dans le quartier de La Part Dieu, nous pouvons dire que tous les chemins mènent à Zenika !
Nous sommes aujourd’hui reconnus pour notre palette d’expertises (Web, DevOps, Big Data, Mobile, IoT, Craftsmanship, Agilité…) mais aussi pour notre rayonnement au sein de la communauté grâce à nos meet-Ups, conférences ainsi que nos formations à fortes valeurs ajoutées.
En dehors de tes missions, tu pourras aussi retrouver tes collègues, lors de parties de babyfoot endiablées, de soirées jeux vidéo, soutenir l’Asvel en faisant un maximum de bruit, des batailles de Nerfs, des sorties nocturnes, mais surtout, toujours dans la bonne humeur !
Tes missions
En tant que Data Ingénieur tu collabores avec les équipes Big Data de nos clients pour concevoir et développer de nouvelles architectures de flux de données.
Tu seras amené à intervenir sur différentes briques Kafka.
Tu pourras développer des applications temps réel et/ou optimiser les ressources d’un cluster.
Qui es-tu ?
Tu as une première expérience significative sur un projet Kafka.
Tu es fan de Kafka Connect, Kafka Streams ou KSQL
Tu souhaites te challenger sur des infrastructures distribuées et temps réel à forte volumétrie.
Tu aimes partager tes compétences et assumer tes choix techniques.
La programmation orientée objet est un art dont tu maîtrises les techniques secrètes (design patterns).
Tu es fan de programmation fonctionnelle.
Tu es familiarisé avec des Frameworks de tests tels que JUnit, Mockito, Gatling.
Tu préfères utiliser tes compétences "relationnelles" pour faire du team building plutôt que pour concevoir le stockage de vos données.
Le NoSQL n’a pas de secret pour toi
Le stream processing est la philosophie que tu as adoptée pour tes projets data (Spark, Flink, Kafka Streams, …)
Tu ne t'imagines pas travailler sur un environnement autre que Linux (Ubuntu, CentOS)
Tu es sensible aux approches craftsmanship (CleanCode, TDD).
Tu t’investis sur la qualité des projets, tu adhères aux principes DevOps et tu es vigilant sur la performance.
Même si tu n’es pas tombé dedans quand tu étais petit, tu as une réelle appétence pour le développement.
Github, Gitlab, Stackoverflow ou encore bitbucket font partie de tes outils de veille quotidiens ?
Tu aimes échanger et partager avec tes pairs et tu aimerais participer à des événements.
Tu as hésité à passer le CAPES car tu es un formateur dans l’âme et tu souhaites en faire bénéficier le plus grand nombre
Tu ne te prends pas trop au sérieux et tu aimes travailler dans un environnement fun et convivial ?
Qu’est ce qu’on t’offre?
En résumé, Zenika, te permettra :
De travailler au sein d’une équipe passionnée avec de l’entraide mais surtout de la bonne humeur,
De choisir d’intégrer ou quitter les projets clients de ton choix
De travailler dans un environnement agile
De réaliser des missions d’audit, d’expertise technique et des POCs
D’avoir du temps dédié pour contribuer à des projets Open-Source ou à tes projets personnels
D’animer ou de participer à des événements techniques
De participer aux meilleures conférences (Devoxx, Devfest, Breizhcamp, MixIT, BDX I/O, Snowcamp et bien d’autres)
D’avoir la possibilité de devenir formateur sur tes domaines d’expertise
De bénéficier de nos formations et de passer des certifications
De choisir ton matériel informatique (PC, Mac etc.)
De conserver un équilibre vie pro/vie perso (notamment avec le télétravail, les RTT,…)
Surtout, d’avoir ta garde robe aux couleurs de Zenika !
Ce que tu ne trouveras pas chez nous ?
Un poste en freelance, full remote
Un projet en centre de services où tu ne feras que de la TMA
Un management directif
Le vouvoiement
Un CEO/manager inaccessible et dans un bureau fermé
Une hiérarchie pyramidale
Du cycle en V
Ok, et si ton profil est retenu, que se passe-t-il ensuite ?
Tu rencontreras le/la chargé.e de recrutement afin de préciser tes attentes et les mettre en perspective avec ce que l'on peut te proposer chez Zenika.
La rencontre est positive, super ! On continue ! tu échanges avec le Directeur d’Agence & le Directeur Technique qui te présenteront l'agence, les missions potentielles et surtout notre manière d'accompagner nos collaborateurs dans leur parcours professionnel.
Ce que l'on peut te proposer te plait ? parfait ! Dernière étape, un échange avec un de tes pairs mais surtout un de tes futurs collègues, un expert de nos équipes, qui évaluera avec toi ton potentiel technique !
Les 3 étapes se sont bien déroulées ? Magnifique, tu n'as plus qu'à dire oui à notre proposition d'embauche pour nous rejoindre !
Nous misons avant tout sur des profils, des potentiels et des personnalités. Le meilleur moyen de voir si ça match, c'est de postuler chez Zenika !
Type d'emploi : CDI
Salaire : 35 000,00€ à 55 000,00€ /mois

In this environment, a new position is open in our EMEA headquarter based in Saint Didier au Mont d'Or (69) , France for:
EMEA INSECTICIDES PROJECT MANAGER (M/F)

Job description
In close contact with the EMEA organization, for the projects you will be assigned to (current and future portfolio for biorational and conventional products), you will be responsible for the evaluation, development and registration trials as well as relevant sections of the registration dossiers. You will also ensure the transmission of the product know-how internally and externally through product's training or support for demo trials protocols.

Your main tasks will be
ü Plan, budget, organize, contract and follow the field trial program
ü Prepare synthesis and technical summaries
ü Prepare (with external support) the efficacy sections of the registration dossiers
ü Contribute to the definitions of our product strategies
ü Transfer the product know-how to internal and external customers

You will benefit from a large autonomy to bring forward your proposals and secure your creativity to complete those tasks.

The Marketing Product Managers

description:
Danone recherche un(e) STAGE Chef de projet - Customer Data Management h/f - 6 mois - Janvier/Février 2020 - Région de Lyon en France (FR) à Limonest (Région de Lyon)
Cette année, nous célébrons les 100 ans du Yaourt Danone !
100 ans d’innovation au service de la santé.
Préparons ensemble les 100 prochaines années !

Une alimentation saine nécessite une planète saine et c’est ce que notre signature « One Planet, One Health » incarne.

Au-delà des mots, quelles sont les réalisations ?
Que ce soit chez Nutricia, Danone Eaux France, Danone Produits Frais, Blédina, apporter le meilleur taux de service à nos clients et consommateurs est l’objectif prioritaire de notre fonction Supply Chain ! Livrer nos produits dans des conditions optimales et au meilleur coût sont les défis quotidiens relevés par nos équipes dans chacun de nos sites en France.

Nos fiertés ?
Les équipes Supply Chain de Danone Produits Frais France maintiennent un CSL (Customer Service Level) le plus optimal possible afin d’éviter le surstockage et la destruction alimentaire.
Chez Blédina, les équipes Supply Chain ont mis en place le « multidrop ». Un camion livre aujourd’hui plusieurs entrepôts pour limiter le nombre de camions sur la route et diminuer l’impact environnemental.

Retrouvez l’ensemble de nos actions : http://corporate.danone.fr/fr/accueil/#

#Supply Chain #Logistique #Stock #Flux #Prévisions #Expéditions #Usines #Transport #Marchandises #Déploiement #Planification #Ordonnancement #Export #CustomerService #Performance #Commandes #Clients

STAGE Chef de Projet “Customer Data Management”– Limonest (69) – Janvier/Février 2020

LE CONTEXTE
Blédina, filiale française de DANONE pour l'alimentation Infantile, est leader sur le marché avec des marques comme Gallia ou Blédichef. La passion de Blédina : faire grandir les bébés. Pour cela, nous créons, fabriquons et vendons des produits qui favorisent leur épanouissement. C'est avec ces valeurs que Blédina est le n°1 de l'alimentation infantile en France. Blédina possède trois usines en France & le siège est basé à Limonest, à proximité de Lyon.

LES MISSIONS :

Intégré(e) à l’équipe Business Support de la direction Supply, vous serez responsable d’un projet pour répondre aux exigences de notre Business en lien avec nos clients, fournisseurs et de nos équipes Blédina de la direction Supply mais aussi des autres directions (Qualité, Commerciale et Marketing). Ce poste nécessite une grande aisance avec les systèmes d'information d'exécution, une connaissance et un fort intérêt pour le transport et la logistique et/ou les activités du service client ainsi qu'une approche orientée performance opérationnelle des processus de la Supply. Tous les projets traités nécessitent de travailler en même temps sur 3 axes : processus, systèmes mais aussi formation/organisation.

Missions opérationnelles (30%)
Piloter un processus Master Data Supply en support de l'équipe en optimisant taux de service client, coûts logistiques, satisfaction client via services proposés.
Mission Projet (70%) : Projet d’amélioration de nos processus de gestion de données clients pour la nouvelle division SN (Specialized Nutrition) (70%)

Mener un projet d’amélioration et de fusion de nos processus de gestion des données clients avec toutes les équipes de la direction Supply SN, Directions commerciales de Blédina et de Nutricia mais aussi en relation avec nos clients (Hôpitaux et Pharmacies). Projet transversal au sein de différents services Supply mais aussi commercial.

OBJECTIF : Dématérialisation/digitalisation du processus afin de maximiser l’efficacité du processus hors flux ERP.

ETAPES :
Analyse du 2 processus existants (Blédina & Nutricia) pour identifier les pistes de productivité (NVA) et la suppression des supports papiers en zoomant sur les différentes étapes du processus
Recommandations d'optimisation avec mise en place d’un processus 100% digital avec un système de workflow en mode Saas ou intégré SAP
Validation du processus cible avec les différents acteurs
Mise en place des nouveaux processus : adaptation et/ou réalisation avec une méthode agile itérative
Définition des formations associées et accompagnement du changement
Pilotage de la performance avec les KPI associés : création de tableaux de bords clés

Interfaces :

Directions Commerciales Blédina et Nutricia
Service Clients de la direction Supply

VOTRE PROFIL

Etudiant(e) en Bac+4/5 minimum, issu(e) d’une formation d’ingénieur, école de commerce ou université – Disponible en Janvier/Février 2020 pour 6 mois.
Capacité à nouer des relations avec tout type d’interlocuteur et capacité à embarquer sur des projets.
Agilité pour s’adapter à un contexte très changeant et des opérations très dynamiques.
Bonne capacité d’organisation et de priorisation vous permettrons de réussir sur cette mission
Outils : Excel, SAP R/3 (si possible), appétence pour les systèmes d'informations au global
Une première expérience en Supply Chain ou Analyse de Processus est un plus
LES PLUS DE CE STAGE

Découverte et exposition business (Service Customer Opérations = service de la Supply Chain très connecté au business)
Développer ses compétences sur des projets d’amélioration continue
Animation élargie et conduite du changement
La possibilité d’apporter des recommandations concrètes et un regard neuf (c’est ce qui fera la différence !)
Une gratification allant de 1120€ (Bac+4) à 1300€ (Bac+5) brut/mois
CE SONT EUX QUI LE DISENT

« Pouvoir travailler en relations avec les entrepôts clients, le prestataire transport, l'usine et les autres services de la supply, permettant ainsi d'avoir une vision beaucoup plus large du fonctionnement de l'entreprise et plus précisément de la chaîne d'approvisionnement. » Stagiaire. Danone Eaux France (Rungis). Stage de fin d'études Bac +5

Source : Enquête Happy Trainees 2019
Retrouvez tous les avis de nos stagiaires et alternants ici

ET MAINTENANT ?

Si cette offre vous correspond, n’attendez-plus votez pour le monde dans lequel vous voulez vivre et rejoignez le mouvement ! Postulez !

Une entretien téléphonique RH avec Pauline
Un entretien physique avec le manager du poste

description:
Group NEXANS is a global provider of advanced cabling systems, solutions and innovative services, with headquarters based in Paris, France. For over 120 years, the Group has been providing customers with cutting-edge cabling infrastructure for power and data transmission. Today, beyond cables, it advises customers and designs solutions and services that maximize performance and efficiency of their projects in four main business areas: Building & Territories (including utilities, e-mobility), High Voltage & Projects (covering offshore wind farms, submarine interconnections, land high voltage), Telecom & Data (covering data transmission, telecom networks, hyperscale data centers, LAN), and Industry & Solutions (including renewables, transportation, Oil & Gas, automation, and others). NEXANS is standing out for its innovation capacity, while giving a particular focus on the Corporate Social Responsibility by supporting the actions for energy access for disadvantaged populations across the globe.
Since its foundation at the end of the 19th century, the company has been continuously developing through acquisitions and merges, growing into today’s global Group operating all over the world. Today, NEXANS has an industrial presence in 34 countries and employs around 27 000 people worldwide as a global leader in wiring solutions and advanced connectivity.
The recently launched global transformation plan targets a substantial increase in customer and market proximity, integrating a new strategy focus on innovation and energy & data management services. The aligned Group’s Procurement organization interacts with all relevant stakeholders at a Corporate, Business Group and regional/local scope in order to help ensure efficient achievement of the Group’s value creation targets at business level.
As part of the further development of the global Procurement organization, the Group is looking for a Raw Material Manager – Business Group Northern Europe, based in Lyon, France.
Raw Material Manager –* Business Group Northern Europe*

Management and Optimization of Regional Portfolio of Raw Materials

Group NEXANS is a global provider of advanced cabling systems, solutions and innovative services, with headquarters based in Paris, France. For over 120 years, the Group has been providing customers with cutting-edge cabling infrastructure for power and data transmission. Today, beyond cables, it advises customers and designs solutions and services that maximize performance and efficiency of their projects in four main business areas: Building & Territories (including utilities, e-mobility), High Voltage & Projects (covering offshore wind farms, submarine interconnections, land high voltage), Telecom & Data (covering data transmission, telecom networks, hyperscale data centers, LAN), and Industry & Solutions (including renewables, transportation, Oil & Gas, automation, and others). NEXANS is standing out for its innovation capacity, while giving a particular focus on the Corporate Social Responsibility by supporting the actions for energy access for disadvantaged populations across the globe.

We help teams and companies focus on what they do best. We take away manual work, paper documents, broken offline processes and wasted time. In other words, we’re a cloud based business ecosystem automation provider focused on streamlining processes among trading partners.
Yeah, that’s a mouthful, but so are our +3,200 businesses globally, including some of the largest retailers in Europe. By joining our team, you’ll have the change to manage a suite of products in a fast-growth environment.
You should be…
A digital project manager – You are a digital project manager with Agile methodology knowledge and an understanding of business process automation. The projects you’ll be responsible for are part of an intelligent business automation suite and involve multiple cross-platform tools.
A decisive planner – Automation platforms are fine tuned to customer needs and thus require a very fine segmentation of the entire development process, using iterations that may only last for a few weeks.
An interface between your team and customers – You’ll ensure that the solution meets the needs of our clients.
A coordinator of the entire production process – You’ll work with multiple production teams, but also interface with marketing, sales and customer support. You’ll make sure that both project budget and time are respected.
A development accelerator – Through collaboration, flexibility, and the famous “test and learn” principle, you will accelerate the development phases of the project and define the problems that need to be solved.
What you are going to do
You will work closely with customers, engineering, UI/UX, marketing, sales and presales to build products that our customers love.
Analyze our competitors and develop ways to outperform them in terms of product capabilities.
Coordinate and supervise the product roadmap. Validate with key customers and stakeholders.
Maintain a prioritized backlog and evaluate it periodically, based on business value, effort and risk
Define, write and communicate product requirements in line with product scope and buyers’ and users’ expectations
Write user stories – simple, but comprehensive descriptions of the customer’s needs.
Collaborate with Marketing & Sales to create product demos
Perform customer development process and develop relationships with our client in order to determine use cases and new product capabilities.
Coordinate and organize project-related meetings and trainings, when needed.
What you should know to get along fine
Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business
A business and a technical mind. Some marketing knowledge would also be great.
Agile / Scrum certifications and at least 2-3 years of relevant job experience.
Excellent communication skills: written and oral as well as presentation skills
Good at collaboration with a variety of technical, business or end-user community.
Grit and self-starter, able to identify things that need improving and find ways to solve them.
Rigor and organization
Good command of English, French would be a plus
From our part
We guarantee you will have the opportunity to work in a scale-up culture and make an impact on thousands of consumers. We will offer you every available tool, technologies or support you need to learn or perfect yourself.
About DocProcess
DocProcessdevelops cloud-based solutions for process optimization and automation in procurement, logistics and finance and accounting departments. Our solutions are used in retail, DIY, manufacturing, logistics, BPOs (Business Process Outsourcing) and SSCs (Shared Service Centers) and also in utilities, healthcare, insurance and banking.
Since its foundation in 2005, DocProcess has aimed at creating value at a business ecosystem level, betting on an open, fast and automated environment. Open – meaning that companies can easily collaborate, with harmonized processes and systems that communicate seamlessly; fast – where business data is sent and processed in real-time, accurately and standardized, being easily mined with AI algorithms, and automated – an environment where employees don’t waste time on manual tasks and disjointed processes, but rather, use that time for more strategic actions.
Founded in 2005,DocProcesshelps companies with digital transformation services. Our services and platforms streamline and automate procurement, logistic, accounting and financial processes (Purchase-to-Pay, Order-to-Cash) helping companies to eliminate paper documents and manual, repetitive work, entirely. Over 3,200 global customers and over 25,000 users are now more productive thanks to our solutions.

Joblift - Grenoble (38)
titre_poste: Postdoctoral Researcher - Educational Sciences / Psychology of Education
date_publication:
Capijobnew.com - il y a 6 jours

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Société : SCIENCE-COMMUNITY.ORG NETWORKSECTOR: Higher Education Institution

INSTITUTION: Univ. Grenoble Alpes, University of Innovation

LOCATION: France, Grenoble

ANR PROJECT TITLE: BTM-Traj Beginning Teachers’ Motivation Trajectory: a developmental approach to understand its evolution during the transition from initial training to the first years in the profession.

JOB PROFILE: Post-Doctoral Researcher

SCIENTIFIC HOSTING DEPARTMENT LaRAC Laboratoire de Recherche sur les Apprentissages en Contexte

SUPERVISER’S NAME: Nadia Leroy

RESEARCH FIELD: Educational Sciences / Psychology of Education

RESEARCHER PROFILE: Recognized researcher (PhD holder not yet fully independent)

Job Profile

Context

The LaRAC Research Laboratoire de Recherche sur les Apprentissages en Contexte (https://larac.univ-grenoble-alpes.fr/) is looking for a post-doctoral fellow as part of a research project funded by the ANR.

The project is supported by the LaRAC in collaboration with the SENS laboratory (https://laboratoire-sens.univ-grenoble-alpes.fr/le-sens- team) of the Grenoble Alpes University as well as the Department of Foundations and Practices in Education of the Faculty of Education (https://www.fse.ulaval.ca/research/) of LAVAL University in Quebec.

The general objective of BTM-Traj project is to identify the different motivational trajectories of teachers’ early career to investigate whether there are categories of novice teachers who are less likely to adjust to environmental demands and who are more at risk of leaving the profession earlier than others. BTM-Traj project addresses one main question: Do Beginning Teachers’ Motivation Trajectories (BTM-Traj) matter and to what extent do they have meaningful consequences? There are three sub-objectives: 1) To better understand how the motivation of Beginning Teachers (BT) evolves during their early years and how these different trajectories jointly evolve with their job satisfaction and their professional development trajectories. 2) To shed light on the environmental (i.e., perceived pressure vs. supportive working conditions) and individual factors (i.e. value, expectation and self-efficacy) involved in explaining belonging to different motivational and career trajectories in order to identify the factors which lead to early resignation and to retention in the profession. 3) To study how developmental trajectories of BTM explain the effectiveness of teaching practices (e.g., supportive vs. controlling motivational climate) in terms of students’ motivation (e.g., motivational regulations, personal goals).

Missions

The postdoctoral researcher will be responsible for conducting a research, under the direction of Nadia Leroy MCF in education sciences, in partnership with the actors of the BTM-Traj project (researchers and research engineer of the SENS laboratory and researcher of the Faculty of Education at Laval University in Quebec City).

He will develop and lead the methods of exploitation, collection and analysis of data collected during the longitudinal study that he will pilot, and will ensure the valorization (publications, conferences, seminars, scientific reports.) He will take part in the related tasks necessary to carry out the research, as well as to the scientific activities of the laboratory of membership, and will guarantee the quality and validity of the data produced and the treatments carried out.

Mission 1 == > plan and conduct longitudinal studies: Contribute to the development of original research hypotheses, define appropriate protocols for research questions and audiences that will be defined; lead and pilot the collection and analysis of the data collected; Organize, supervise and carry out data collection in collaboration with research collaborators and field partners; Recruitment ; Participate in analysis under the supervision of the project manager; Ensure compliance with deadlines and the planned schedule
Mission 2 == > ensure a scientific information watch: ensure an information watch in the main scientific databases related to the development of the motivation of beginning teachers; ensure an informational watch on conferences, seminars, conferences, related to the theme of the BTM-Traj Project »
Mission 3 == > pilot the valorization of the obtained results: to value the data collected through publications, conferences or national or international symposia; Organize study days (one per year) to disseminate and promote the results of the research; communicate the results to non-specialist audiences (seminars, "mass-audience" conferences); Write the final report to the funders and participate in writing the interim reports by task; Contribute to the writing of scientific articles (mainly in English; Ensure the transfer of knowledge to the partners in the field.
Applicants must hold a PhD degree or have a University degree equivalent to a European PhD (8-year duration)

Applicants will have to send an application letter in English and attach:

Their last diploma (certificate of successful completion of the doctorate)o A summary of the thesiso A summary of research topicso Their CV o The contact of two reference personso Letters of recommendation are welcome

Application deadline October 15th2019 at 12:00 (CET)

Applications will be evaluated through a three-step process:
Eligibility check of applications in October 30th 2019

1st round of selection: the applications will be evaluated by a Review Board in October 31th 2019. Results will be given in November 4th 2019.

2nd round of selection: shortlisted candidates will be invited for an interview session in Grenoble on November 15th 2019.

Address to send their application to: Nadia.leroy@univ-grenoble-alpes.fr

Project Manager (Website Administration)- Mapi Research Trust


Location: Lyon, France

Are you looking for a position where you can change people’s lives for the better? If yes, this is a phenomenal opportunity - apply to start the new journey.

Mapi Research Trust (MRT) is a non-profit organization dedicated to improving patients’ quality of life by facilitating access to Patient-Centered Outcome (PCO) information. We promote scientific approaches in the PCO field and encourages exchanges between academics, pharmaceutical companies, and international organizations around the world in the service of incorporating the patient’s voice into every step of the development process of new treatments. https://mapi-trust.org//

We are looking for a Website Administrator/Project Manager to join our MRT team in Lyon. In this role you will be responsible for coordination, execution, control and completion of single service projects ensuring consistency with SOPs, service-line best practices, project contracts and budgets.


Overview of role:
ePROVIDE portal administration and assisting product owner in the management of database portal, qualification of users’ needs, writing of scope of work/specifications documents
Participate in the selection of providers and the chosen solution
Manage relationships with the providers, and maintenance follow-up on a daily basis
Perform database portal modeling, structuration and settings, ensure data/databases migration, perform tests, check deliveries and quality check developments, contribute to the definition of formats and rights and rules in the context of the applicable norms and standards
Act as a coordinator with the users and contributors by investigating their needs and their usage of the database portal, Write guidelines and instructions
Client/User support: answering inquiries related to databases about content and user experience
Leading client demos in WebEx/TC/F2F, follow-up of client’s feedback (coming from clients, BD or others)
Reporting: update of tables and monthly dashboards
Proficiency in English (written/oral)
Experience of managing projects- timelines, risk management and budget perspective
Work with minimal supervision and demonstrate appropriate initiative when making decisions and problem-solving. Demonstrate flexibility and an open-minded approach to task completion
Next steps:

Following your application you will be contacted by one of our dedicated recruiters and if successful we will be able to provide you with more details about this opportunity.
LI-EJ1



Mapi Research Trust and ICON Plc are equal opportunity employers - Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans and committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment

description:
Amaris is an independent, international Technologies and Management Consulting Group. Created in 2007, Amaris is already established in over 50 countries and supports more than 850 clients worldwide throughout their project's lifecycle. Our expertise covers five areas of innovation: Business and Management, Information Technologies, Engineering and High Technologies, Telecommunications and Biotech and Pharma. With more than 65 offices across the world, the Group offers proximity support to its clients in all their locations and many opportunities of international careers for employees. In 2019, Amaris aims to reach a turnover of 350 million euros, 6500 employees and to develop its workforces with the anticipation of a further 2000 new job openings. We expect to triple our workforce within the next few years and reach a leading international position in independent consulting.

Your Role

Journey and workplace department support the group with services for employees and by establishing global partnershis with suppliers. Providing worlwide offices solutions by considering twi main most important aspects:
1- Real estate (financial study, subcontracting);
2- Facility Management (Coherence & performance of offices);

Role
As a project Workplace Planner Intern, you will be exposed to the many facets of the real estate industry including: finance, development, marketing, legal, property management and construction. You will gain hands-on experience working on projects at various development stages and you will have the opportunity to work alongside a large diversity of collaborators within Mantu.
The program will start with 2 weeks of incubation ,you will spend Two weeks dedicated to know and interact with all the department (procurement,Legal,office Management,..) . You will have the opportunity to job-shadow the Workplace Manager in Lyon and participate in day-to-day operations so that you’re exposed to all aspects of the job at an early stage.
You will also have the opportunity to work autonomously on projects that will be assigned to allow you to develop deeper knowledge into specific topics and contribute to the team.

Examples of potential assignments may include:
Property Management: manage the bidding and awarding of a property improvement
Project Construction: catalog data regarding bid costs and actual costs for construction
Development: create a project schedule, review site plans
Research: identify and catalog new suppliers: maintain and expand supplier platform, work on project “design and build”.

Requirements:
Currently enrolled in a Master/engineer in industrial engineering or related field (Real estate or Construction Management)
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Exceptional organization skills
Must be flexible, detail-oriented and comfortable with multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment
Ability to interact and communicate professionally with a variety of people including executives, consultants, suppliers, and clients
Familiarity with legal documents, such as leases and contracts, is a plus.

description:
Note: This role is for Belvilla, part of OYO Vacation Homes.
Bonjour! Nice meeting you!

OYO is the fastest growing tech company in the hospitality industry worldwide. Our mission is very simple: helping guests find their perfect space across 80+ countries with 23000+ rooms and 46000+ holiday homes. We are transforming the experience both for guests and owners to combine hospitality with cutting-edge technology. Now part of the OYO Vacation Homes family – Belvilla is one of the leading vacation rental companies in Europe.

As Sales Manager at Belvilla France, you will play a leading role in achieving our ambitious acquisition and revenue growth objectives in France. You will manage a team of Business Developers in your region to actively develop our portfolio, offer our brand new value proposition to the french Home Owners, and foster our amazing expansion in Europe. Join us to thrive in high growth, disruptive and tech-driven business currently transforming the whole hospitality industry!


What will you do?
Develop the strategy on how to achieve growth and hit acquisition targets by successfully managing the sales team
Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands the company’s homeowners base and ensures its strong presence on the market
Own recruiting, acquisition objectives setting, coaching and performance monitoring of sales agents
Build and promote strong, long-lasting homeowner relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs
Manage and control the contracting process, paying special attention to gross margins and availability
Present acquisition, revenue and expense reports and realistic forecasts to the management team
Identify emerging markets and market shifts while being fully aware of trending houses and competition status
Analyze the market and manage strategic product acquisition to ensure Belvilla’s strong competitive position on the market in the future
Ensure correct and updated product information

What you will bring?
BS/MS degree in tourism, business administration or a related field
Written and verbal fluency in English and French
Successful previous experience as a sales manager, consistently meeting or exceeding targets
Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization
Proven ability to manage the sales process from plan to close
Strong business sense and vocational rental industry expertise
Excellent mentoring, coaching and people management skills
Commercially savvy, good knowledge of the market and ability to build strong relationships.
Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making skills
Computer fluency. Knowledge of Tableau is a plus
Results-oriented, proactive, client-oriented

Read more:
https://oyovacationhomes.com/oyo-to-acquire-amsterdam-based-leisure-group/
https://oyovacationhomes.com/leisure-group-announces-rebranding-to-oyo-vacation-homes/
https://techcrunch.com/2019/08/14/oyo-vacation-rental-europe/

description:
La Digital Agency d'Orange Digital et Data
C'est une équipe de designer de service digitaux, composée d'UX Designer, d'UI Designer, de profils polyvalents UX/UI, d'UX Project Manager, et de consultant en Design Thinking, au service des enjeux business et usages de nos clients.
C'est une offre d'accompagnement en design complet et sur mesure, qui mixe des activités au forfait et en régie, pour répondre aux problématiques de nos clients.
C'est une organisation sur 3 agences (Paris, Lyon et Nantes), pour être au plus près de nos clients.
Afin de développer notre équipe sur Lyon, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents UX/UI pour nos activités d'agence.
Votre rôle à la Digital Agency : Think and Do !
Comprendre les utilisateurs, et les positionner au centre du travail de réflexion et de conception visuelle
Réaliser les interfaces digitales et les faites évoluer en fonction des retours utilisateurs et des besoins clients.
Accompagner le client et l'équipe projet dans la démarche User centric
En tant que Designer d'interfaces, accompagner vos collègues designers dans leur montée en compétence. Votre sens de l'écoute, votre état d'esprit collaboratif et votre bonne humeur sont attendus par toute l'équipe !
Votre mission…si vous l'acceptez
Vous interviendrez dans le cadre de projets clients BtB ou BtC, d'univers professionnels différents (industrie, tourisme, publique, sport, e-commerce…), sur tous types de devices (mobile, tablette, desktop, objets connectés, machines industrielles…) et sur de multiples typologies projets (forfait, agile, audit, …)
Vous serez le garant de l'expérience utilisateur, vous proposerez des solutions aux problématiques client et serez en charge du design des interfaces du produit
Vous travaillerez avec les consultants en Design Thinking sur la stratégie d'accompagnement client
Vous travaillerez au côté d'UX designers pour co-concevoir la meilleure ergonomie d'interface
Avec une forte appétence pour les méthodes d'UX Design, vous avez la capacité à mener des phases de qualification et d'analyse des besoins client et utilisateur
about you
Ce que l'on aime chez vous, c'est que vous êtes unique !
Vous êtes un designer dans l'âme, et votre vécu professionnel est riche d'expériences variées. Venant d'agence digital ou d'ESN, vous avez une expérience (5 à 10 ans).
Vous êtes curieux et aimez apprendre et parfaire vos connaissances sur les usages et comportements utilisateurs, les méthodologies et l'innovation. Vous possédez une forte culture digitale.
Vous aimez comprendre le problème avant de chercher la solution. Vous possédez de l'autonomie et une force de proposition.
Vous savez vous adapter et communiquer.
Vous avez d'indéniables qualités graphiques.
Vous utilisez les outils de tout bon designer (Sketch, Invision, …)
Et surtout vous êtes human centric !
Alors, venez exprimer votre talent, et vivre une expérience humaine et professionnelle riche !
On vous attend !... Avec les croissants 
department
Digital & Data
Partenaire de la transformation digitale des entreprises, Orange Digital&Data est l'entité d'Orange Business Services spécialisée dans la conception et le développement de services applicatifs et l'intégration de systèmes.
Implantés dans plusieurs grandes villes françaises comme Paris, Rennes, Lyon, Bordeaux, Lille et Toulouse … nous accompagnons au quotidien près de 20 000 entreprises tout au long du cycle de vie de leurs projets, dans les domaines clés de l'expérience digitale, de la Data Analytics et l’Intelligence Métier.

description:
Why SoftwareONE?
Today SoftwareONE is a global leader in software and cloud portfolio management and is modernizing the way organizations budget and optimize their global IT spend from on-premises to the cloud.
Our 5,000 technology experts located across 80+ countries work on over a 1,000 Technology Projects globally. We provide customers with the right advice on their Technology Roadmap towards the cloud or optimizing the Business-outcome of a cloud-based landscape. With our PyraCloud platform, applying machine learning, delivering the visibility, insight, automation and control customers demand to maximize their software investments.
In tandem, our Software Lifecycle Management (SLM) services provide the methodology and framework to optimize the underlying IT infrastructure, accelerate cloud adoption and minimize compliance risk.
With our dynamic leadership and driven business strategy SoftwareONE is one of the fastest growing technology solution providers in the world with elite partnerships with Microsoft, AWS, Adobe, IBM, VMware, Oracle, Citrix, Red Hat, Trend Micro and many more.
The role
The Inside Sales works together with the Business Development Managers to develop and maintain favorable relationships with new and existing clients in order to increase revenue and ensure that SoftwareONE products and services consistently meet client needs. This role is responsible for sustaining and renewing client contracts, as well as systematically pursuing customer opportunities.
Contact with current customers on a daily basis.
Establish and expand relationships with key executives and decision makers within each customer and territory.
Develop and maintain exceptional consultative relationships with existing customers.
Work collaboratively with assigned Business Development Managers to develop an overall account plan, which will maximize opportunities and generate sales activity with customers and partners.
Grow and maintain existing customer and partner relationships
Manage day-to-day customer and partner requests.
Develop strong knowledge of leading industry trends through ongoing training with software publishers.
Act as key resource for leading industry volume license offerings.
Drive PyraCloud adoption.
Ensure accurate customer on boarding and visualization of customer data in PyraCloud.
Achieve quality benchmarks, including minimum number of credit memos.
Drive proactive renewals and overall opportunity management.
What we need to see from you
Knowledge of: operational policies and procedures; customer service and sales probing techniques; and developing and maintaining long-term business relationships.
Ability to: analyze data, identify trends and develop recommendations for improvement; research and solve complex, multi-faceted problems; work independently and show initiative; maintain a positive attitude; handle large volumes of work and meet tight deadlines; adapt to and embrace change in a rapidly changing environment; lead and mentor by example; maintain and promote good client relations, maintain confidentiality of sensitive information.
Skilled in: relationship building; verbal and written communication; problem solving; researching customer and product information; planning, scheduling, and organizing work; multitasking; and time management.
1-3 years professional sales experience preferred but not required.
Customer service experience preferred.
Highly motivated and results oriented; entrepreneurial spirit.
Detail oriented with ability to break down projects into smaller tasks.
General understanding of technology solutions.
Proficient in and knowledgeable with Microsoft’s licensing programs and product stack.
What you should really know about us.
Strip away everything. Strip away our brand, strip away our buildings, strip away our offices. What are we left with? Our people. This is what makes SoftwareONE successful.
Passionate people who live and breathe our values every day, who delight our customers, every day, and who go above and beyond, every day. Our culture is unique, and I believe that having the right people, and empowering them to succeed, is the absolute key to our success.
Patrick Winter, Founder.
What we expect from our employees
Success at SoftwareONE is not defined by what you do for yourself, but by what you deliver for our customers, the business and for the employees around you.
SoftwareONE employees are energized, agile and are laser focused on delivering world class Customer Satisfaction and results. Our leaders motivate and inspire their teams and provide a working environment that delivers incredible levels of Employee Satisfaction. We are Humble, have a very high degree of Integrity and are simply not interested in politics.
Our leaders operate with a high levels of Discipline but are able to work at Speed manage change in a global economy.

description:
Position:
2020 Graduate Account Manager
Job Description:
At Arrow we embrace technology to make people’s lives better
Join our EMEA graduate program and be part of a company that is changing the world
On this exciting program, you will be employed in your sales role on a permanent contract from day one and eligible for Arrow’s comprehensive remuneration and benefits package.
We will work side by side to accelerate your transition from a fresh graduate into the business world and kick start your career in sales.
We will provide you with a solid foundation of skills… all the support and training that you will need, including a mentor, continuous development and coaching.
You will join a team of Graduates based across Europe, making new friends and forming crucial working relationships. You will be learning in a group with fellow graduates, as part of a team with other Arrow employees and alone on personal projects. You will work in your home country but will also rotate on a quarterly basis in different countries across Europe. Training will be delivered by attending face to face sessions and via state-of-the-art e-learning tools.
A mentor will be assigned to guide you, support you and will be involved in monitoring your progress and providing feedback throughout your journey.
You will also focus on gaining on-the-job experience. Arrow believe that by integrating you fully into the business and giving you the responsibility for your tasks is the best way to learn. We will assign practical work alongside your personal and group projects.
You will meet and learn from experienced people from a variety of teams : sales, pre sales, engineering, marketing, finance & operations. You will work alongside experts in their field and will support them in the following tasks :
Demand creation
Run market analysis & analyze the internal history data (customer, sales…) to identify & target areas to create demand for Arrow as a Technology Lifecycle Service Provider
Work with marketing to promote offerings & services and generate new business opportunities
Qualify prospects, analyze the sales potential and prioritize high return opportunities for further investment
Sales Generation :
Based on a fundamental understanding of Arrow as Technology lifecycle service provider, identify the appropriate solutions to match the customer business needs
Understand Arrow resources available to support and how to leverage these at the appropriate time to close opportunities
Develop strategic customer marketing & sales plans
Shadow a Field Sales executive while they negotiate commercial contracts/deals with their customers
Relationships
Build customer and supplier business relationships by having a good knowledge of current & future industry & competitor’s offerings, trends & technology
Learn how to become embedded in accounts, develop deep relationships vertically and horizontally
Develop and maintain a broad relationship with customers, suppliers & Arrow colleagues
Other, specific to the program
Take responsibility for projects (individual and in group) and create innovative solutions that have an impact on what Arrow does as a business
This 12 month journey will allow you to learn how we operate on the day to day basis and how you can make an important difference supporting our customers.
Apply now
You should check that you meet the selection criteria:
you should have successfully completed their university degree studies in a Business related or other relevant degree before the program starts early October 2020.
you must be flexible and have geographical mobility
you must have a legal right to work in the country the position is located
Fluency in English and local language where the job is based are key requirements of the program
You will also have a strong desire to:
Innovate: creating new and improved ways for themselves and the organisation to be successful.
Collaborate: building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Work differently: networking and working with colleagues across other cultures and in other countries.
Be accountable: taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, successes and failures.
Achieve results: displaying a can-do attitude and strive to accomplish objectives.
Put customers first: building strong relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
In order to apply, please click on Apply below and submit your CV and a letter of motivation (both in English) in which you provide responses to the following questions:
What was your decision-making process in selecting your current course/degree discipline?
What motivates you about the graduate position you have applied for?
What skills and experiences do you feel have prepared you for the graduate position?
What skills and experience are you seeking to develop through the 12-month graduate program?
What personal qualities will you bring to the graduate position?
Your letter of motivation should not exceed one page.
We can only accept applications from candidates that submit a letter of motivation in accordance with the above instructions.

Lyon
Time Type:
Full time

Business Support
